item.title: Agent Toolkits: MultiON MultiON recently came out of stealth, and has shown impressive long-horizon agent planning / execution: https://x.com/DivGarg9...
item.description:
Agent Toolkits: MultiON

MultiON recently came out of stealth, and has shown impressive long-horizon agent planning / execution:

https://x.com/DivGarg9/status/1747683043446579416?s=20

It's absolutely worth trying as an agent that can perform open-ended tasks. And if you already have workflows using LangChain‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1748404710686785629


Div Garg:‚ÄÇWe just solved the long-horizon planning & execution issue with Agents ü§Ø!

Excited to announce that @MultiON_AI can now take actions well over 500+ steps without loosing context & cross-operate on 10+ websites as part of a single task ü§©!!

Our latest upgrade cracks the goal‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1747683043446579416
item.author: LangChain

item.title: üîé Structured Outputs with Google Gemini One of the killer features of OpenAI models is function calling - which allows you to structure the respons...
item.description:
üîé Structured Outputs with Google Gemini

One of the killer features of OpenAI models is function calling - which allows you to structure the responses of the LLM.

Google Gemini supports the same type of function calling - and we've now added a chain to make it super easy in‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1748403680423117309

item.description:
RT‚ÄÇJacob Lee
üå≤ Pinecone Serverless ü§ù LangChain JS üå≤

You can now use brand new @pinecone serverless vectorstores with @LangChainAI ü¶úüîó JS/TS via a new integration package!

It supports all the latest features, plus existing indexes.

Thank you @zackproser:

https://js.langchain.com/docs/integrations/vectorstores/pinecone

item.title: RT Plotly: Congratulations to Troy Scribner, the first-place winner of the Plotly-LangChain Community App Challenge! ü•á Troy created StockNews, comb...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇPlotly
Congratulations to Troy Scribner, the first-place winner of the Plotly-LangChain Community App Challenge! ü•á

Troy created StockNews, combining Plotly Dash with @LangChainAI and @ChatGPTapp to answer questions about current stock market news for companies in the S&P500. The app‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1748069001677402117
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Tomaz Bratanic: LLMs can be brittle at generating Cypher, even if you use GPT-4. In my latest blog post, I have written about ensuring robustness o...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇTomaz Bratanic
LLMs can be brittle at generating Cypher, even if you use GPT-4. In my latest blog post, I have written about ensuring robustness of LLMs interacting with a knowledge graph through the implementation of semantic layers with @LangChainAI and @neo4j.

https://medium.com/towards-data-science/enhancing-interaction-between-language-models-and-graph-databases-via-a-semantic-layer-0a78ad3eba49
item.author: LangChain

item.title: ‚ô†Ô∏èSPADE: Synthesizing Assertions for Large Language Model Pipelines SPADE analyzes prompt version histories to create candidate assertion functions ...
item.description:
‚ô†Ô∏èSPADE: Synthesizing Assertions for Large Language Model Pipelines

SPADE analyzes prompt version histories to create candidate assertion functions and then selects a minimal set that fulfills both coverage and accuracy requirements.

https://arxiv.org/abs/2401.03038
item.author: LangChain

item.title: üîßTool Usage w/ LangChain A big use case for LangChain is making it easy for LLMs to call tools. This can range from putting a simple natural-langua...
item.description:
üîßTool Usage w/ LangChain

A big use case for LangChain is making it easy for LLMs to call tools. This can range from putting a simple natural-language-interface on top of a function, to agents

We've revamped our docs to highlight this use case more. New guides include:‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1748027236635312254

item.description:
RT‚ÄÇJacob Lee
üê° Turbopuffer Vectorstore üê°

@turbopuffer, a "truly serverless" vectorstore that bills only for storage, queries, & writes, integrates with @LangChainAI ü¶úüîó JS/TS in community 0.0.18!

They run cool stuff like @cursor_ai.

s/o @mattzcarey & @Sirupsen:

https://js.langchain.com/docs/integrations/vectorstores/turbopuffer

item.description:
RT‚ÄÇAfiz ‚ö°Ô∏è
How to use LangChain with Ollama?

@ollama lets you run open-source models like llama-2 locally. And @LangChainAI makes it easy to use locally running models.
